intro: Seriola tweediei, commonly known as the yellowfin seriola, is a species of marine fish belonging to the family Serranidae. It is characterized by its streamlined body, which is adapted for swift movement through open waters. The fish typically exhibits a yellowish to golden coloration, with a distinctive silver lateral line running along its body. It is found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. This species is valued for its high-quality flesh and is often targeted by commercial fisheries.
